alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Florence and southern Darlington Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cartersville, or 15 miles southeast of Bishopville, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Timmonsville, Lamar and Cartersville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 127 and 138. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 146 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
